wikipedia_page.main:
Peter Wyatt Kininmonth (23 June 1924 – 5 October 2007) was a Scottish international rugby union player, who played for Scotland and the Lions. He also played for Oxford University and Richmond RFC. He was educated at Sedbergh School.
He was on the 1950 British Lions tour to New Zealand and Australia.He was also a businessman and High Sheriff of Greater London in 1979–80.

link_mentions.page: 1950 British Lions tour to New Zealand and Australia

response: The Mass of Reconsecration was conducted on 16 August 1981, led by The Most Rev. Dr. Dermot Ryan, Lord Archbishop of Dublin, who emphasised the historic nature of such an event.  Invitees included family, friends and locals, with Tony O'Reilly's mother as guest of honour and hymn selector, music by Caroline O'Reilly and John Grogan, prayers by Tony O'Reilly, Junior, and readings by Cameron O'Reilly and Tony O'Reilly's friend, rugby player Peter Kininmonth.  Holy water, incense and chrism oil were used, and a chalice from the 1932 Eucharistic Congress Mass in Dublin.  A silver chalice from 1643 was presented to the owner for use in subsequent Masses.
